page.title: 06Farming:arable.
page.content: We questioned Mr.Skilbeck about farming in our area.As well as a dairy herd he and his brother keep beef cattle which are either sold at Murton Livestock Centre for beef,or sold to the local wholesale butcher,who has an abbatoir.Most of the farms locally are arable,growing mainly sugar beet (for British Sugar Corportion),barley,wheat and potatoes.The most noticeable change of late has been in the growing of high yielding,winter sown cereals, such as barley,harvested in late July, and wheat,harvested in late August.In 1985 there was an appeal called the Great Grain Trail organised by the N.F.U. for the starving in Ethopia. 40,000 tons of grain were donated by farmers in the region,who also covered the cost of its transport to Hull docks.
